SEARCH
Module com.example.loginpage
Package com.example.loginpage.module.books.typeofbooks

Class FamilyBook

java.lang.Object
com.example.loginpage.module.books.Book
com.example.loginpage.module.books.typeofbooks.FamilyBook
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public non-sealed class FamilyBook extends Book
Represents a book classified under the family genre that may include additional suitability criteria for children. This non-sealed class can be further extended to accommodate more specific types of family books. This class extends Book,It adds a property to determine whether the book is appropriate for younger readers.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • FamilyBook

      public FamilyBook(int id, String title, String author, int year, String genre, String description, String imageSrc, int votes, boolean suitableForChildren)
      Constructs a new FamilyBook with detailed book information and suitability for children. Initializes all fields with the provided values, including the suitability flag.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier for the book.
      title - The title of the book.
      author - The author of the book.
      year - The publication year of the book.
      genre - The genre of the book.
      description - A brief description of the book.
      imageSrc - A URL or path to an image of the book's cover.
      votes - The number of votes or ratings the book has received.
      suitableForChildren - A boolean indicating whether the book is suitable for children.

    • FamilyBook

      public FamilyBook()
      Default constructor for creating a FamilyBook with uninitialized fields. This constructor sets up a new FamilyBook instance without initializing its properties.

  • Method Details

    • isSuitableForChildren

      public boolean isSuitableForChildren()
      Returns whether the book is suitable for children.
      Returns:
      true if the book is suitable for children, otherwise false.

    • setSuitableForChildren

      public void setSuitableForChildren(boolean suitableForChildren)
      Sets the suitability of the book for children.
      Parameters:
      suitableForChildren - A boolean indicating whether the book should be suitable for children.

    • printInfo

      public void printInfo()
      Prints detailed information about the FamilyBook, including its general information and its suitability for children. This method overrides the printInfo method from the Book superclass to add additional information about the book's suitability for children.
      Overrides:
      printInfo in class Book

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Provides a string representation of the FamilyBook, including its suitability for children. This method appends the suitability information to the string representation provided by the Book superclass.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Book
      Returns:
      A string representation of the FamilyBook, including details about its suitability for children.
